definition: to spread falsehoods/to increasingly distort the truth/to pile errors on top of errors (idiom)
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: There are really a great many tragedies caused by spreading false news.
sentences.chinese: 以讹传讹造成的悲剧真是太多了。

sentences.english: Gabrielle: Well, I think you're paraphrasing .
sentences.chinese: 我知道你是在以讹传讹。

definition: unfounded rumor/to pass on a mistaken belief to others
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
three men talking makes a tiger (idiom); repeated rumor becomes a fact
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
to concoct a cock-and-bull story (idiom)/to make things up
lit. public opinion is powerful enough to melt metal (idiom)/fig. public clamor can obscure the actual truth/mass spreading of rumors can confuse right and wrong
lit. to put Zhang's hat on Li's head/to attribute sth to the wrong person (idiom)/to confuse one thing with another
to sensationalize (idiom); deliberate exaggeration to scare people
